intro: Piper muricatum f. peninsulare, commonly known as the Peninsular pepper or *Piper muricatum* var. *peninsulare*, is a tropical shrub native to the Andean regions of South America. It is characterized by its aromatic, spiny stems and heart-shaped leaves with a glossy surface. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that develop into elongated, spiny fruits containing aromatic seeds. The leaves and fruits are used in traditional medicine and as a spice due to their pungent flavor. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests at higher elevations.
